document.masterDocTitle: Two new species, one unrecorded species, and one newly reported male of genus Thiallela Walker, 1863 from China (Lepidoptera: Pyralidae: Phycitinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species, one unrecorded species, and one newly reported male of genus Thiallela Walker, 1863 from China (Lepidoptera: Pyralidae: Phycitinae)

bibRefCitation.refString: Walker, F. (1863) Crambites & Tortricites. In: List of Specimens of Lepidopterous Insects in the Collection of the British Museum. Vol. 27. Printed by order of the Trutees, London, pp. 1 - 286.

subSubSection.paragraph: Male genitalia (FIG. 10). UNCUS HOODLIKe, SLIGHTLY bROADeR THAN LONG, ROUNDeD AT APeX, SeTOSe IN DISTAL HALF ON DORSAL SURFACe. APICAL PROCeSS OF GNATHOS AbOUT 3/4 LeNGTH OF UNCUS, bROAD AT bASe, TAPeReD TO 2/3, SLeNDeR AND HOOKeD IN DISTAL 1/3. TRANSTILLA WITH TeRMINAL PART FUSeD INTO A WeLL SCLeROTIZeD SADDLe-SHAPeD PLATe, WITH A PAIR OF ROUNDeD POSTeROLATeRAL PROCeSSeS. VALVA GRADUALLY bROADeNeD TO ROUNDeD APeX; COSTA A NARROWeD bAND, eXTeNDING TO eND OF VALVA, NeARLY eqUAL WIDTH eXCePT SLIGHTLY TAPeReD DISTALLY; SACCULUS 3/5 LeNGTH OF VALVA, TRIANGULAR, bROAD AT bASe, TAPeReD TO A DISSOCIATeD, POINTeD APeX; CLASPeR NARROW, eLONGATe, SLIGHTLY SINUATe, ARISING FROM bASe OF COSTA ObLIqUe OUTWARDLY TO DISTAL 1/3 OF POSTeRIOR MARGIN, beYOND eND OF SACCULUS, WITH A TRIANGULAR FLAP AT bASe, beARING SPAReS SeTAe. JUXTA V-SHAPeD, LATeRAL LObeS WeLL DeVeLOPeD, AbOUT 3/4 LeNGTH OF APICAL PROCeSS OF GNATHOS, FINGeRLIKe, SLIGHTLY TWISTeD, SWOLLeN bASALLY, WITH A FeW SeTAe APICALLY. VINCULUM V-SHAPeD, LeNGTH SLIGHTLY SHORTeR THAN TRANSVeRSe POSTeRIOR MARGIN. AeDeAGUS CYLINDRICAL, 3/4 LeNGTH OF VALVA; WITH TWO CLUbbeD CORNUTI: ONe AbOUT HALF LeNGTH OF AeDeAGUS, ITS DISTAL PART SLIGHTLY beNT, PROTRUDeD, FORMING TWO MINUTe TINeS, ONe SLIGHTLY SHORTeR, DeNTATe ON DISTAL MARGIN. EIGHTH AbDOMINAL TeRGITe FAN-SHAPeD; eIGHTH AbDOMINAL STeRNITe TRIANGULAR, ASSOCIATeD WITH A PAIR OF CULCITA.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Female genitalia (FIG. 14). PAPILLAe ANALIS SeMIeLLIPTICAL, WITH VeSTURe OF LONG, THIN HAIRS. APOPHYSIS POSTeRIORIS SLIGHT SLeNDeR AND SHORTeR THAN ANTeRIORIS. EIGHTH AbDOMINAL SeGMeNT SHORT AND bROAD, TeRGITe V-SHAPeD CONCAVe ON POSTeRIOR MARGIN;
A LIP-LIKe SCLeRITe POSTeRIOR TO eIGHTH AbDOMINAL SeGMeNT. ANTRUM WeLL DeVeLOPeD, TRAPeZOIDAL, POSTeRIOR MARGIN AbOUT 1.5 TIMeS AS WIDe AS ANTeRIOR MARGIN
, WITH A PAIR OF CALAbASH-SHAPeD HeAVILY SCLeROTIZeD AReA ON LATeRAL SIDeS.
DUCTUS bURSAe MeMbRANOUS, AbOUT SAMe LeNGTH AS ANTRUM, PUNCTATe ON INNeR WALL
.
CORPUS bURSAe MeMbRANOUS, OVATe, 1.6 TIMeS AS LONG AS WIDe
, WITH A qUADRATe PLATe NeAR jUNCTION WITH DUCTUS bURSAe, AND A qUADRATe AReA DeCORATeD WITH COARSe SCObINATIONS; SIGNUM A STRONG beNDING HORN ON A bROAD bASe, SITUATeD AT AbOUT MIDDLe OF DUCTUS bURSAe, PUNCTATe AROUND. DUCTUS SeMINALIS INCePTeD POSTeRIOR MARGIN OF CORPUS bURSAe, SAMe SIDe WITH SIGNUM.

Notes .
Thiallela ligeralis
IS ReCORDeD FOR THe FIRST TIMe FROM
CHINA
.

We CHeCKeD TYPeS OF
ligeralis
( FIG. 6 ),
signifera
(FIG. 7) AND
pallidobasella
(FIG. 8) DePOSITeD IN BMNH UNDeR THe HeLP OF MR. DAVID Lee. DeSPITe THe SLIGHTLY DAMAGeD WING PATTeRN, We CAN STILL ReCOGNIZe THAT THeSe SPeCIMeNS RePReSeNT THe SAMe SPeCIeS, SO We AGRee WITH ROeSLeR & KüPPeRS’S VIeW (1981) THAT
signifera
AND
pallidobasella
ARe SYNONYMS OF
ligeralis
. THe CHINeSe SPeCIMeNS ARe DARKeR IN COLOR THAN THeSe TYPeS, AND SUFFUSeD WITH MORe GRAYISH GReeN SCALeS IN bASAL HALF, bUT THe GeNITALIA CHARACTeRS ARe IDeNTICAL WITH
T. ligeralis
STATeD AND DRAWN bY ROeSLeR & KüPPeRS (1981, FIGS. 55.120) .
